com.observability.monitoring.server

Class ModelHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • com.observability.monitoring.server.ModelHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IModelHandlerServer, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ModelHandler
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements IModelHandlerServer
    ModelHandler is the a RMI service. It has the following functionalities:
    1. Communicate with model editor to get configuration files
    2. Save & unzip the files on disk
    3. Propagate them to remote nodes by communicating with daemon manager

    Tests:
    Model handler:
    java com.obrvability.monitoring.server.ModelHandler 128.237.201.134 17680
    Daemon manager:
    sudo java com.observability.moniting.daemon.DaemonManager 45.55.197.112 17670

    Author:
    Ying (Joel) Gao

    History:
    1. Created Jun 22 2015
    2. Modified Jun 23 2015

    See Also:

      Begin the uploading process.
      int deployModel(java.lang.String target)
      Deploy the uploaded configuration files with the name 'target'.
      If you have called endFileUpload, this method will be called automatically.
      You can call this method to deploy those already uploaded zip files.
      For example, v5 is uploaded and deployed in current system, but you want to roll back to v4,
      you can call this method directly (as long as v4 files are still persistent on disk).

    • Method Detail

      • beginFileUpload

        public boolean beginFileUpload(java.lang.String target)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: IModelHandlerServer
        Begin the uploading process. Client should get true to continue.

        The zip file will be saved as 'target.zip' (don't have .zip in your target parameter).
        It will be unzipped to a folder named 'target' to extract all configuration files.

        Specified by:
        beginFileUpload in interface IModelHandlerServer
        Parameters:
        target - the target file and directory
        Returns:
        true/false
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - connection error
        See Also:
        IModelHandlerServer

      • uploadFileChunk

        public boolean uploadFileChunk(byte[] buffer)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: IModelHandlerServer
        Upload a file chunk.
        For big file, it must be divided into chunks and uploaded separately.
        Client can use different chunk size. Default chunk size is 512KB.
        Specified by:
        uploadFileChunk in interface IModelHandlerServer
        Parameters:
        buffer - the byte array of the file chunk
        Returns:
        true/false
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - connection error
        See Also:
        IModelHandlerServer

      • endFileUpload

        public int endFileUpload(java.lang.String md5)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: IModelHandlerServer
        End the file uploading process.
        Program will verify the MD5 of the received file against the parameter to ensure integrity.

        Program will unzip the file and propagate all configuration files to remote nodes.
        This method may take a long time in a large system.

        Specified by:
        endFileUpload in interface IModelHandlerServer
        Parameters:
        md5 - MD5 hash value of the file in client system
        Returns:
        the number of configuration files that are successfully transfered, negative for error
        -1 : file error
        -2 : MD5 checksum error
        -3 : unzipped directory error

        -21 zip format not supported
        -22 zip file not valid
        -23 zip file cannot be read due to security reason -24 cannot create target directory

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - connection error
        See Also:
        IModelHandlerServer

      • deployModel

        public int deployModel(java.lang.String target)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: IModelHandlerServer
        Deploy the uploaded configuration files with the name 'target'.
        If you have called endFileUpload, this method will be called automatically.
        You can call this method to deploy those already uploaded zip files.
        For example, v5 is uploaded and deployed in current system, but you want to roll back to v4,
        you can call this method directly (as long as v4 files are still persistent on disk).
        Specified by:
        deployModel in interface IModelHandlerServer
        Parameters:
        target - the name of the uploaded configuration zip file
        Returns:
        the number of configuration files that are successfully transfered, negative for error
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - connection error
        See Also:
        IModelHandlerServer
